Update 4.5.2 is okay. Game is playable.

Do not buy this game. Devs do not listen to the community whatsoever. The entire community hates on the changes and they push it out anyway. They change the game at a snails pace its awful. The game became so old because they never push out changes and when they do they just make the game worse. Literally the worst devs I've ever seen in my life. Not to mention the game is also the most unbalanced thing ever. Survivors and Killers can bring perks, addons, and items to make the game a 90% chance they win. This happens in most matches. Not to mention the solo q experience is absolutely atrocious. Every game your tm8s will dc or be so awful to the point that every game you have a 15% chance to survive. Every match is also completely unbalanced. People with 2k hours go against people with 100 hours constantly. Literally nothing about this game is good. The skill cap is at like 400 hours theres no point to playing after. Theres no ranked mode and no reason to even get the highest rank in the game, no reward, no badge, nothing. Out of respect for the developers ruining the game please do not buy this game. They don't deserve your money.
Used to be fun. Then 4.5.0 happened. Now it's hot garbage. Nevermind that. Still fun <3
üëç

Normally this game is okay with their updates. Sure, some may be annoying to get use to, but they are often overall better for the health of the game.

The new UI update is not that. It split the compact and convenient old UI system into 5 pieces, sending them to literally 5 different parts of the screen. In a game where every second counts, and status changes happen so frequently, it's hard to believe how this made it out of the Public Test Build (PTB).

A full revert back to the old UI is senseless. The new updated graphics are nice (they could be better, but it's a very nice start), but it's almost unplayable in it's current state. The developing team should really consider a more compact version of their new UI, at least for some of the components.

ORIGINAL REVIEW 2021-02-10
For quite some time now this game is completely broken. If I want to win - I'm playing killer, any killer... all of them move 150% faster then survivors. 
Balance is gone for months, now with new movement animations and UI randomly placed all over the screen I can see directions this game is going... straight to the garbage bin!
I was waiting for patch, and then next and next... This game is not worth playing. Devs can't see that 80% of killers are rank 1, 20% have rank 4 and above, and skills that before would mean rank 19 max!
If you want to know how to completely destroy a good game, ask Behaviour Interactive.

UPDATE 2022-07-17
After reading PTR and changes "because killers are so weak - we need to boost them" - LOL! I present to you: company that is developing the game that they know nothing about!

FINAL UPDATE 2022-07-30
I have wasted way too much time and money on this game, only reward being a middle finger from devs. For over a year now, BHVR focused on promoting LGBTQXYZ instead of focusing on quality of the game. Direction that was taken by movie producers as well resulting in tons of movies that nobody wants to watch not to mention pay a ticket for cinema. And no! not because of LGBT content in them... because there is absolutely nothing else. 
I thought that games can hold against "new fashionable genders" as GAMERS DON'T CARE!  trash talk was always part of competitive gaming, politics not! 
So all focus from devs is going to new cosmetics, stories promoting LGBT and piece by piece destroying quality of the game. 

R.I.P Dead by Daylight

The problem is the rest of the update was great the perk nerfs and the clown changes were needed and will help the game move in a health way but they had to ruin it with this.

Coming from a long time Dead by daylight player on PS4 now playing on PC. I do not understand the dev team's thought process, they release a Public Test Build weeks before a new chapter update. Why is the game riddled with new and old bugs on ever new chapter launch day? Why is the new killer not balanced correctly? Trickster (New Killer) was weak in the public test build, why weren't there changes implemented on the release day for balance? Behaviour Interactive Inc. has had the same mediocre output since Jun 14th 2016 when dead by daylight released, and now that its 2021 they are starting to make me lose interest.

changing previous review which was mainly a rant on 4.5.0 (which is still inexcusable in my opinion since it should've never been released leaving the game practically unplayable for about a week but i digress).

just hear me out

I love this game. One of my all time favorites. However, I still can't FULLY recommend this to other newer players simply due to the grind and unpredictability of the devs. Over the years, the game has grown....a LOT. This is great but it leaves newer players in a bit of a tough spot. right now, if you were to buy the base game (20$), you are essentially blocked from using 60% of the perks available. about half of those perks can only be brought by DLC or being very lucky in this sort of perk lottery which is the shrine of secrets. You would have to essentially be playing for hundreds or possibly thousands of hours to be able to unlock all the free killers and survivors and that is still leaving the other half of the roster which can only be payed for (in which the amount is starting to sharply rise as more licensed DLC starts being released). The devs also seem to be at a standoff with the community. this was highlighted in patch 4.5.0 which everyone hated and was still released in an even worse condition. It took a review bombing and a huge outcry for them to finally resolve their mess of an update after two weeks (there are more instances but i don't want this review to be just shitting on the devs since i really do believe they are good at what they do...just a little misinformed). Other issues like rank still not mattering after 4+ years, long queue times, etc. are also very annoying and have been brought up time and time again by the community only to fall on deaf ears or mentioned and then later forgotten. 

but for as sometimes frustrating this game is for new and old players alike, it is still a really good game unlike any other. The devs should be proud of their creation and hopefully we won't get another complete mess of an update like 4.5.0. I highly suggest giving this game a try if you want a different experience from the over saturation of other genres like FPS shooters, battle royales, etc. If it means anything, your first few games will be terrifying and i wish i could go back to my first moments of this game

Ive played this game for almost 5 years and its incredibly unique, which is what keeps me coming back. There really isnt another asymmetric horror game quite like Dead By Daylight which is really just unfortunate. The devs have shown time after time that they are just too stubborn about their own decisions to make any decent changes and much needed game balances. 
Some bugs have been in the game for around a year and a half(game breaking ones). 
The devs have a "work when they want to" mindset which on one hand makes BHVR a great place to work, but for the people who bought their game it is a GLARING problem. 
BHVR has a monopoly on this kind of game, and the second a better dev team steps up to rival DBD, i will be jumping ships.

The inability of BHVR to listen to the community when making changes to this game is such a glaring problem that it cannot be ignored. Not only do they break something new with each update, but they also implement things that nobody even wants and instead of rolling out timely patches to these issues they create, they always have time to roll out new overpriced skins in the store. I might have recommended this game before the most recent update, but this update has shown that people should just not play this horrendously managed game.
